extendedIngredients.name: almond milk
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup Silk Unsweetened Vanilla Almond Milk

extendedIngredients.name: maple syrup
extendedIngredients.originalString: maple syrup for serving, or your favorite topping (try Vanilla Maple Syrup or Ginger Molasses Maple Syrup)
metaInformation: for serving, or your favorite topping (try vanilla maple syrup or ginger molasses maple syrup)

recipes.title: Cinnamon Sugar French Toast Sticks
recipes.instructions: Preheatelectric griddle(takes about 10 minutes) or preheat a non-stick skillet over medium heat a minute or two before you'll need it; set aside. In a large mixing bowl, combine eggs, milk, sugars, vanilla, cinnamon, nutmeg, and whisk until combined. Butter the griddle or skillet. Dip 1 slice of bread into the coating mixture for about 5 to 10 seconds, flipping over once, and making sure it's well-coated before adding to griddle; don't let bread become overly saturated because it'll break and fall apart. Repeat with all slices of bread until coating mixture is gone. Cookfor about 3 minutes per side, or until as done and browned as desired, flipping and rotating the sticks so all sides are cooked and browned. Add more butter to griddle or skilletas necessary and wipe griddle with paper towel as necessary to remove black bits. Serve immediately with maple syrup or your favoritetopping. French toast sticks are best warm and fresh, but will keep airtight in the refrigerator for up to 5 days or in the freezer for up to 6 months and can be gently reheated in the micro or toaster.

steps.step: Preheatelectric griddle(takes about 10 minutes) or preheat a non-stick skillet over medium heat a minute or two before you'll need it; set aside. In a large mixing bowl, combine eggs, milk, sugars, vanilla, cinnamon, nutmeg, and whisk until combined. Butter the griddle or skillet. Dip 1 slice of bread into the coating mixture for about 5 to 10 seconds, flipping over once, and making sure it's well-coated before adding to griddle; don't let bread become overly saturated because it'll break and fall apart. Repeat with all slices of bread until coating mixture is gone. Cookfor about 3 minutes per side, or until as done and browned as desired, flipping and rotating the sticks so all sides are cooked and browned.
Add more butter to griddle or skilletas necessary and wipe griddle with paper towel as necessary to remove black bits.

Serve immediately with maple syrup or your favoritetopping. French toast sticks are best warm and fresh, but will keep airtight in the refrigerator for up to 5 days or in the freezer for up to 6 months and can be gently reheated in the micro or toaster.
